==APT Repository for D==

==="d-apt" is an ATP repository to easily install/upgrade D binary packages on Debian-like systems.===


To enable it, just edit "/etc/apt/sources.list" and add the following line:
{{{
deb http://d-apt.googlecode.com/files /
}}}
Update local info and import d-apt public key:
{{{
$ sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get --yes --allow-unauthenticated install d-apt-keyring && sudo apt-get update
}}}
----
The following binary packages are available:

 * dmd (http://dlang.org/)

 * libgtkd-dev (http://www.dsource.org/projects/gtkd)
 * libgtkd-doc

 * libplot2kill-dev (https://github.com/dsimcha/Plot2kill)

 * libtango-dev (https://github.com/SiegeLord/Tango-D2)
 * libtango-doc

 * libdcollections-dev (http://www.dsource.org/projects/dcollections)
 * libdcollections-doc

 * liborange-dmd-dev (https://github.com/jacob-carlborg/orange)
 * liborange-dmd-doc
----
Debianized source packages not available.
----
Every dev package contains a "pkg-config" configuration file for the specific library.

To compile "gtkd" applications:
{{{
$ dmd `pkg-config --cflags --libs gtkd` my_gtkd_app.d
}}}

To compile "plot2kill" applications, which depends on "gtkd":
{{{
$ dmd `pkg-config --cflags --libs plot2kill gtkd` my_plot2kill_app.d
}}}

All dev packages contains both 32-bit and 64-bit static libraries.

To compile 64-bit "tango" applications on a 32-bit system:
{{{
$ dmd `pkg-config --cflags --libs tango` -m64 my_tango_app.d
}}}
